Name: Primisulfuron
Description: Primisulfuron is a member of benzoic acids.

plant_translocations.content: The study found that broadleaf signalgrass is sensitive to nicosulfuron but resistant to primisulfuron, while corn is resistant to both herbicides. The research aimed to determine the effect of varying light levels and air temperatures on the absorption, translocation, and metabolism of nicosulfuron and primisulfuron in broadleaf signalgrass and corn. Corn absorbed between 60% and 85% of the applied nicosulfuron and primisulfuron within 72 hours after treatment (HAT), depending on the environmental conditions. Absorption, translocation, and metabolism were all more rapid at higher temperatures and light intensities. Translocation of both herbicides out of the treated leaf in corn was less than 4.5% of the herbicide absorbed through 72 HAT. Corn rapidly metabolized both herbicides, with primisulfuron being metabolized more rapidly than nicosulfuron. Broadleaf signalgrass absorbed 20% more nicosulfuron than primisulfuron through 72 HAT. Nicosulfuron translocation out of the treated leaf in broadleaf signalgrass was less than 15% of the absorbed herbicide through 72 HAT, while primisulfuron translocation was about 40% during the same period. Primisulfuron metabolism was more rapid than nicosulfuron in broadleaf signalgrass.
plant_translocations.reference: Gallaher, K., Mueller, T. C., Hayes, R. M., Schwartz, O., & Barrett, M. (1999). Absorption, translocation, and metabolism of primisulfuron and nicosulfuron in broadleaf signalgrass (Brachiaria platyphylla) and corn. Weed science, 47(1), 8-12.

method.Apply Location: Foliar application on the adaxial surface of the second uppermost fully expanded leaf
method.Plant Grown Condition: Plants were grown in a commercial soil-less potting mix in the greenhouse. Seeds were sown in 470 mL cups, thinned to 1 plant per cup at 10 days after planting (DAP). Watered as needed and fertilized weekly with 300 μg/g NO₃⁻, P₂O₅, K₂O solution until runoff. Moved to growth chambers at 15 DAP and allowed 4 days to equilibrate.
method.Chemical Preparation: 14C-nicosulfuron (85% purity) and 14C-primisulfuron (99% purity) treatment solutions prepared in 1:1 water:acetonitrile mixture with 0.25% nonionic surfactant. Each 8 μL application contained 2.08 kBq 14C-nicosulfuron or 2.25 kBq 14C-primisulfuron.
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: Plants sprayed with 32 g ai/ha nicosulfuron and 36 g ai/ha primisulfuron using commercial formulations in 90 L/ha carrier volume with 0.25% nonionic surfactant in a moving-nozzle spray chamber.
method.Other Information: Randomized block design with species as block effect and 4 herbicide x environment combinations as treatments within blocks.

plant_translocations.result: [{"Plant": "Corn", "Pretreatment": "High light", "Translocation to shoots (% of absorbed)": 1.3, "Translocation to roots (% of absorbed)": 0.2}, {"Plant": "Corn", "Pretreatment": "Low light", "Translocation to shoots (% of absorbed)": 0.4, "Translocation to roots (% of absorbed)": 0.1}, {"Plant": "CornBroadleaf signalgrass", "Pretreatment": "High light", "Translocation to shoots (% of absorbed)": 4.1, "Translocation to roots (% of absorbed)": 1.8}, {"Plant": "CornBroadleaf signalgrass", "Pretreatment": "Low light", "Translocation to shoots (% of absorbed)": 1.0, "Translocation to roots (% of absorbed)": 0.5}]
